title: fennic
author: fennic
content: Hi guys from yesterday I have been posting on bitcointalk but my posts are increasing not activity and that sucks and it's been 12 hours and none of posts are converted to activity. Any big members have any idea about what is going on with me. I will be pleased to get help.

comments.author: mocacinno
comments.body: you can only increase 14 points every 2 weeks. Next to this, you need a certain amount of merits for each level (but it looks like you have more than sufficient merits to increase your level right now).

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Activity will count every 14 days after you have make up to 14 posts. Do not be bothered about it, just continue to post with good contributions and see your activity to be increasing every 14 days. It will count 14 posts every 14 days at once.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Activity = minimum (post count,  14*N), N= number of two week activity periods in which you made at least one post. You have been active in only 1 two-week activity period. So, 14*N = 14 and your activity can't increase to more than 14.Your activity will increase, once you make your first post in the next two-week activity period.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Here's the link the the activity calendar. It tells the date and time of the start of the next activity period, which is 8:53 (forum time) tomorrow.You can use the sheet in subsequent times to know when to expect an activity push, after making more posts than activities.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: fennic on October 04, 2022, 11:17:44 AM<...>Under certain conditions, you can surpass the 14 Activity points per Activity period by reclaiming past unrealized Activity. That happens when, in a given 2 week Activity period, you make less than 14 post (therefore less than 14 Activity points), but at least 1 valid post in that timeframe. You potentially claim some of these automatically by posting more than 14 posts on a given future Activity period. It’s explained with further detail here.For example, going over your  posting history (scroll to bottom chart), un July you made 2 posts within a given Activity window. That would leave you 12 Activity points claimable in the future by posting more than 14 posts in another Activity window (now for example) … Nevertheless, those two posts were deleted, meaning that the Activity window for them does not have any posts, and therefore the Activity algorithm does not let you claim those (up to) 12 Activity points I was on about before.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: In addition what many users already answered your question,It seems you're forcing yourself to post more in order to increase your activity which is not good since it could make you become a spammer. Just post when you think there's need to be replied either no one answered the question or there's a user who posted a wrong advice/explanation. Sooner or later you can become a high rank member, don't need to think the activity and merit.

But every beginning is difficult and everyone needs to adapt, so I hope that the number of deleted posts will not increase along with activity.Quote from: Despairo on October 04, 2022, 01:15:29 PMSooner or later you can become a high rank member, don't need to think the activity and merit.Maybe the OP will think that I'm one of those who "will roast him", but if profit becomes the main motive, the path to a higher rank will not be easy at all.
